attributes.additional_details: The UK has been instrumental in the current refugee crisis in Afghanistan and we have a moral duty to support them. We have destabilised the country for years and decided to abandon the Afghan population, leaving them to a Taliban insurgency. We have a responsibility to offer refuge.
attributes.background: Support refugees from Afghanistan who are fleeing the Taliban and welcome them to the UK.

rejection.details:
The Home Office announced on 18 August 2021 a bespoke resettlement route for Afghan refugees who have been forced to flee the country. You can read more about it on the gov.uk website: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/bespoke-resettlement-route-for-afghan-refugees-announced

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Help the people of Afghanistan: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594723

Redeploy UK Forces to Afghanistan to protect the citizens against the Taliban: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/594823
